intro: Lonchocarpus angusticarpus, commonly known as the narrow-pod senna, is a tropical legume native to Central and South America. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters tall, featuring compound leaves with 8–12 pairs of oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces yellow flowers followed by elongated, narrow pods that contain several seeds. It has a deep root system and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species in ecological and agricultural contexts.
